section.title: Exercise: Create and run a Groovy script with the Eclipse IDE
Target of this exercise
section.para: In this exercise you learn how to create a Groovy script with the Eclipse IDE.

section.title: Create a new Groovy script
section.para: Use the Eclipse wizard to create a new Groovy class in your existing project.

section.title: Run the Groovy class
section.para:
Right-click your Groovy script, and select
Run As Groovy Script
from the context menu.

section.title: Validate the Groovy script
section.para: The above menu entry triggers the execution of the script and prints output to Console view of the Eclipse IDE.
Congratulation! You created and ran your first Groovy script.

section.title: Decompile the Groovy class file
section.para: If you are familiar with a Java decompiler, like the JadClipse plug-in, decompile the class file generated from your Groovy source file and review it.
Ensure that it is an instance of groovy.lang.Script .
